physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Generalized seizures, fever, MRI showed edema in the left temporal/parietal area of the brain.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI after 19 days showed 2 large ring-enhancing lesions with surrounding edema.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI demonstrating edema and new lesions in both left parietal and occipital lobes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI after 22 days showed increased size of initial lesions and additional lesions.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presented with focal seizures, coma, renal insufficiency, elevated hepatic enzymes, and pancreatitis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient's condition improved over time; initially severe muscle tone and tremor at discharge improved in rehabilitation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI showed multiple new enhancing lesions in the right and cerebellar hemispheres.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No change in the number and size of lesions noted during multiple MRIs over the initial weeks after treatment began.
Initial Balamuthia antibody titer of 1:128, with later titers showing a decrease over time.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Worsening mental status and development of uncontrollable seizures.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After readmission, patient gradually improved, restarting fluconazole therapy with normalized hepatic enzyme levels.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient able to walk independently and communicate effectively after rehabilitation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual decrease in lesion size noted on MRI over the years with no new lesions, and improvement of overall condition.
